meanings.definition: To score too highly or excessively.
meanings.sent1: She kept overscoring in the math test, getting every answer wrong.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overscore his own performance, thinking he did better than he actually did.
meanings.sent3: The robot overscoring its tasks made everyone laugh at its silly mistakes.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project led her to overscore her abilities, resulting in disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's red pen overscoring the essay made the student realize their errors.

meanings.definition: The act of scoring too many points or goals in a game.
meanings.sent1: The team's overscoring in the match surprised everyone, breaking a record.
meanings.sent2: His overscoring in the basketball game led to an overwhelming victory for his team.
meanings.sent3: The cat's overscoring of mice in the backyard made it the neighborhood champion.
meanings.sent4: The overscoring of goals in the final minutes of the game turned the tide for the underdog team.
meanings.sent5: The overscoring of points by the player made the crowd go wild with excitement.
